result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M. Waller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with assessment or counseling as required by Probation & Parole;
Prepare a letter of apology to victim within 30 days as approved by Probation & Parole;

timeConds.notes: Serve 1 day in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 1 day served.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 10-08-2014. Complete all hours by 02-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul M. Waller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Community Service Completion Report.
Obligations of community service completed as of 10/30/2014 as verified by C/S Coordinator.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 10-08-2014. Complete all hours by 02-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.

Judge advises defendant of elements of amended charge in count 1/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest count 1.  PLQ/WRF with attached elements sheet filed with the Court & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  W/hold sentence place on 1 yr. probation with conditions.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Paul M. Waller in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties reached an agreement.  State moves to amend to Misdemeanor level offense.  Joint recommendation 1 yr. probation, follow recommendation of agent, 5 days jail which will be argued for C/S.  Court amends Count 1 of Amended Information to Misdemeanor level.

Jury trial on September 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 8, 2014 at 12:45 pm.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on September 29, 2014.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for September 8, 2014 at 12:45 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than July 23, 2014. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than July 23, 2014, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 - 10 (See Order in File)
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Defendant Paul M. Waller in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1 as stated in the Information & max. penalties and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  NGP entered and JT requested.

Defendant Paul M. Waller in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to Misd. Battery as witness not here to meet burden of P.H.  Court grants Motion.  Witness now appears, State w/draws Motion, granted by the Court.  Witness apologizes for tardiness.  Sworn & examined by the State P.W.  Cross by defense counsel.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State to file Information.
M.S. is required to appear on 06/23/2014 @ 9:45 am
P.S.W. is required to appear on 06/23/2014 @ 9:45 am
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Paul M. Waller in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests P.H., waives time limits.  Referred to Scheduling Clerk.  Bond remains as previously set.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul M. Waller in court, in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond.  Court sets $1000 Sign. Bond with condition:  no contact with his brother, P.W.  Advised of Right to P.H. w/in 20 days.  Defendant wishes to continue hrg.  Court notes waiver of time limits.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
